verses.text: So I \w returned|strong="H7725"\w*, and \w considered|strong="H7200"\w* all the \w oppressions|strong="H6217"\w* that are \w done|strong="H6213"\w* under the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w*: and behold the \w tears|strong="H1832"\w* of \add such as were\add* \w oppressed|strong="H6231"\w*, and they had no \w comforter|strong="H5162"\w*; and on the \w side|strong="H3027"\w* of their \w oppressors|strong="H6231"\w* \add there was\add* \w power|strong="H3581"\w*; but they had no \w comforter|strong="H5162"\w*.\f + \fr 4.1 \ft side: Heb. hand\f*

Wherefore I \w praised|strong="H7623"\w* the \w dead|strong="H4191"\w* which are \w already|strong="H3528"\w* \w dead|strong="H4191"\w* more than the \w living|strong="H2416"\w* which are \w yet|strong="H5728"\w* \w alive|strong="H2416"\w*.

Yea, \w better|strong="H2896"\w* \add is he\add* than \w both|strong="H8147"\w* they, which hath not \w yet|strong="H5728"\w* been, who hath not \w seen|strong="H7200"\w* the \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* \w work|strong="H4639"\w* that is \w done|strong="H6213"\w* under the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w*.

¶ Again, I \w considered|strong="H7200"\w* all \w travail|strong="H5999"\w*, and every \w right|strong="H3788"\w* \w work|strong="H4639"\w*, that for this a \w man|strong="H0376"\w* is \w envied|strong="H7068"\w* of his \w neighbour|strong="H7453"\w*. This \add is\add* also \w vanity|strong="H1892"\w* and \w vexation|strong="H7469"\w* of \w spirit|strong="H7307"\w*.\f + \fr 4.4 \ft every…: Heb. all the rightness of work\f*\f + \fr 4.4 \ft for this…: Heb. this is the envy of a man from his neighbour\f*
The \w fool|strong="H3684"\w* \w foldeth|strong="H2263"\w* his \w hands|strong="H3027"\w* \w together|strong="H2263"\w*, and \w eateth|strong="H0398"\w* his own \w flesh|strong="H1320"\w*.

\w Better|strong="H2896"\w* \add is\add* an \w handful|strong="H3709"\w* \add with\add* \w quietness|strong="H5183"\w*, than both the \w hands|strong="H2651"\w* \w full|strong="H4393"\w* \add with\add* \w travail|strong="H5999"\w* and \w vexation|strong="H7469"\w* of \w spirit|strong="H7307"\w*.
¶ Then I \w returned|strong="H7725"\w*, and I \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* \w vanity|strong="H1892"\w* under the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w*.

There \w is|strong="H3426"\w* \w one|strong="H0259"\w* \add alone\add*, and \add there is\add* not a \w second|strong="H8145"\w*; yea, he hath neither \w child|strong="H1121"\w* nor \w brother|strong="H0251"\w*: yet \add is there\add* no \w end|strong="H7093"\w* of all his \w labour|strong="H5999"\w*; neither is his \w eye|strong="H5869"\w* \w satisfied|strong="H7646"\w* with \w riches|strong="H6239"\w*; neither \add saith he\add*, For whom do I \w labour|strong="H6001"\w*, and \w bereave|strong="H2637"\w* my \w soul|strong="H5315"\w* of \w good|strong="H2896"\w*? This \add is\add* also \w vanity|strong="H1892"\w*, yea, it \add is\add* a \w sore|strong="H7451"\w* \w travail|strong="H6045"\w*.

¶ \w Two|strong="H8147"\w* \add are\add* \w better|strong="H2896"\w* than \w one|strong="H0259"\w*; because they \w have|strong="H3426"\w* a \w good|strong="H2896"\w* \w reward|strong="H7939"\w* for their \w labour|strong="H5999"\w*.

For if they \w fall|strong="H5307"\w*, the \w one|strong="H0259"\w* will lift \w up|strong="H6965"\w* his \w fellow|strong="H2270"\w*: but \w woe|strong="H0337"\w* to him \add that is\add* \w alone|strong="H0259"\w* when he \w falleth|strong="H5307"\w*; for \add he hath\add* not \w another|strong="H8145"\w* to help him \w up|strong="H6965"\w*.

\w Again|strong="H1571"\w*, if \w two|strong="H8147"\w* lie \w together|strong="H7901"\w*, then they have \w heat|strong="H2552"\w*: but how can \w one|strong="H0259"\w* be \w warm|strong="H3179"\w* \add alone\add*?

And if \w one|strong="H0259"\w* \w prevail|strong="H8630"\w* against him, \w two|strong="H8147"\w* shall \w withstand|strong="H5975"\w* him; and a \w threefold|strong="H8027"\w* \w cord|strong="H2339"\w* is not \w quickly|strong="H4120"\w* \w broken|strong="H5423"\w*.

¶ \w Better|strong="H2896"\w* \add is\add* a \w poor|strong="H4542"\w* and a \w wise|strong="H2450"\w* \w child|strong="H3206"\w* than an \w old|strong="H2205"\w* and \w foolish|strong="H3684"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, who \w will|strong="H3045"\w* no more be \w admonished|strong="H2094"\w*.\f + \fr 4.13 \ft who…: Heb. who knoweth not to be admonished\f*

For out of \w prison|strong="H0631"\w* he \w cometh|strong="H3318"\w* to \w reign|strong="H4427"\w*; whereas also \add he that is\add* \w born|strong="H3205"\w* in his \w kingdom|strong="H4438"\w* becometh \w poor|strong="H7326"\w*.

I \w considered|strong="H7200"\w* all the \w living|strong="H2416"\w* which \w walk|strong="H1980"\w* under the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w*, with the \w second|strong="H8145"\w* \w child|strong="H3206"\w* that shall stand \w up|strong="H5975"\w* in his stead.

\add There is\add* no \w end|strong="H7093"\w* of all the \w people|strong="H5971"\w*, \add even\add* of all that have been \w before|strong="H6440"\w* them: they also that come \w after|strong="H0314"\w* shall not \w rejoice|strong="H8055"\w* in him. Surely this also \add is\add* \w vanity|strong="H1892"\w* and \w vexation|strong="H7475"\w* of \w spirit|strong="H7307"\w*.
